adjectives.description: seasoned (comparative more seasoned, superlative most seasoned)

entries.meaning: Experienced, especially in terms of a profession or a hobby
examples: With only two fit centre-backs available, Tottenham boss Harry Redknapp employed young midfielder Jake Livermore at the back alongside Sebastien Bassong but Spurs struggled against a seasoned Champions League outfit, who beat Barcelona at the Nou Camp in 2009-10 and continually worked their way between the home defence to create some golden opportunities.

entries.meaning: Of a food, often a liquid: containing seasonings
examples: Delicious, fresh bread — especially a killer herb-seasoned loaf — and a stellar creamy dill dressing elevate Brother Juniper's sandwiches beyond the routine.

entries.meaning: simple past tense and past participle of season
